Description: Four of the nation's largest home builders agreed to pay civil penalties totaling $4.3 million to resolve alleged violations of the Clean Water Act.
Agency: Justice Department Environment and Natural Resources Division
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2008/June/08-enrd-524.html

Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 23611: Residential Building Construction
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Description: Hovnanian Enterprises, Inc. and PulteGroup, Inc. have agreed to pay civil penalties of $130,000 and $56,000 respectively in separate settlements with EPA resolving alleged Clean Water Act violations at construction sites in Maryland and Virginia.
Info Source: https://archive.epa.gov/epapages/newsroom_archive/newsreleases/7625f14d264560b285257b2600764688.html

Description: Centex and three other home builders agreed to pay a total of $4.3 million to state AGs and the federal government to resolve Clean Water Act violations. The settlement was also announced by the U.S. Justice Department; see the Violation Tracker entry at https://violationtracker.goodjobsfirst.org/violation-tracker/-centex-homes
Info Source: https://www.justice.gov/archive/opa/pr/2008/June/08-enrd-524.html

Company: Pulte Home Corporation and Pulte Mortgage, LLC
Description: Pulte agreed to pay restitution in settlement of allegations that its pre-qualification practices, earnest money deposit policies and Spanish-language marketing efforts violated Arizona's consumer protection law.
Info Source: https://web.archive.org/web/20101228183653/http://www.azag.gov/press_releases/aug/2010/Press%20Release%20-Pulte%209-%202010.html

Description: Pulte Homes and three other home builders agreed to pay a total of $4.3 million to state AGs and the federal government to resolve Clean Water Act violations. Company: Pulte Homes of Ohio, LLC and Woodward Excavating Co.
Description: Pulte Homes of Ohio, LLC and Woodward Excavating Co. (the developer and contractor, respectively) agreed to jointly pay a $36,500 civil penalty in settlement of allegations construction activities did not have the water and sediment discharge controls required by permits.
Info Source: https://www.epa.state.oh.us/Portals/35/enforcement/OEPA%20Pulte%20Orders.pdf?ver=2020-09-22-152021-780
